comments:
N20050623-0010, GTK+ 2.6.7, KDE 3.3.2, X.org 6.8.2, Linux 2.6.11

deselected the "Show Change Sets" tool bar item.  The following exception occurred:

This looks like a threading issue or a JDK bug:
the AIOOBE happens with an index that is internal to the *native* method System.arraycopy. The argument 
passed into ArrayList.toArray is an array of size 0 that forces ArrayList.toArray() to create a new array with 
appropriate size. So the caller DiffContainer.getChildren cannot prevent this from happening.

The only explanation is that some other thread is adding items to the ArrayList while System.arraycopy 
copies the items into the (now too small) array. However, I would expect a 
ConcurrentModificationException in this case.

Since the context of where this exception occurs is o.e.team, I'm moving this report to Team for comment.
We will investigate the concurrency angle in 3.2
*** Bug 130053 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=38087)
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

I also got the AIOOBE in N20060409-0010.

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        at java.lang.System.arraycopy(Native Method)
        at java.util.ArrayList.toArray(ArrayList.java:305)
        at org.eclipse.compare.structuremergeviewer.DiffContainer.getChildren(DiffContainer.java:103)
        at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.DiffNodeWorkbenchAdapter.getChildren(DiffNodeWorkbenchAdapter.java:25)
        at org.eclipse.ui.model.BaseWorkbenchContentProvider.getChildren(BaseWorkbenchContentProvider.java:68)

This is a concurrency issue that involves a constructor that makes a tree available to a background job before the tree is built. The code in question is beoing phased out (i.e. there is a repalcement in 3.2. and the code in question will be deprecated in 3.3).
